content:
Admin Checklist for Intraday Management Setup

Before your planners can launch and use the Intraday Management dashboard, configure Workforce Engagement for Intraday Management. The steps differ depending on whether you’re using an Omni-Channel queue-based routing workflow.

REQUIRED EDITIONS
Workforce Engagement is available in Lightning Experience
Available in: Enterprise, Performance, and Unlimited Editions

For Customers Using an Omni-Channel Queue-Based Routing Workflow
CONFIGURATION STEP	DOCUMENTATION
Step 1: Set up the history and forecast features.	Admin Checklist for Workload History and Forecast Setup
Step 2: Create a workload history.	Create a Workload History
Step 3: Create an Intelligent Forecast.	Create an Intelligent Forecast
Step 4: Set up the capacity plan feature.	Admin Checklist for Capacity Plan Setup

Step 5: Create a capacity plan to meet this criteria:

Is in an Omni-Channel queue-based workflow
Short-term
End time is at least 24 hours in future
Create a Capacity Plan

Step 6: Turn on Intraday Management and Real-Time Adherence.	Enable Intraday Management and Real-Time Adherence
Step 7: If you don’t see Intraday Management in the App Launcher after step 6, ensure that it’s turned on. Check under Tab Settings in your user profile and the profiles of other users.	View and Edit Tab Settings in Permission Sets and Profiles

Step 8: Take the steps in the Admin Checklist for Shift Scheduling Tools.	Preparing for Shift Scheduling
Step 9: Create shifts. Ensure that your shifts and your Intraday Management Dashboard are associated with the same service territory.	Create Shifts

Step 10: Set up the shift segments feature.	Preparing to Use Shift Segments
Step 11: Create shift segments.	Create Shift Segments

Optional: Enable email toast notifications in your email client (such as Gmail or Outlook) or another flow that alerts agents to an incoming email. Agents receive automated email notifications when a new shift is assigned to them or when one of their assigned shift segments has changed.	Find the instructions in your email client’s documentation.

Optional: Disable the email notification feature.	Rest API Developer Guide: Notification Setting

For Customers Not Using Omni-Channel Queue-Based Routing
CONFIGURATION STEP	DOCUMENTATION
Step 1: Turn on Intraday Management.	Enable Intraday Management and Real-Time Adherence
Step 2: If you don’t see Intraday Management in the App Launcher after step 1, ensure that it’s turned on. Check under Tab Settings in your user profile and the profiles of other users.	View and Edit Tab Settings in Permission Sets and Profiles

Step 3: Take the steps in the Admin Checklist for Shift Scheduling Tools	Preparing for Shift Scheduling
Step 4: Create shifts. Ensure that your shifts, your service resources, and your Intraday Management Dashboard are all associated with the same service territory.	Create Shifts

Step 5: Set up the shift segments feature.	Preparing to Use Shift Segments
Step 6: Create shift segments.	Create Shift Segments

Optional: Enable email toast notifications in your email client (such as Gmail or Outlook) or another flow that alerts agents to an incoming email. Agents receive automated email notifications when a new shift is assigned to them or when one of their assigned shift segments has changed.	Find the instructions in your email client’s documentation.

Optional: Disable the email notification feature.	Rest API Developer Guide: Notification Settings

Enable Intraday Management and Real-Time Adherence
Activate the Intraday Management dashboard and real-time adherence.
title: Admin Checklist for Service Cloud Intraday Management Setup
